intro: Didymocarpus stolzii var. minor, commonly known as the small-fruited sandstone apple, is a shrub native to arid regions of South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, woody fruits that resemble apples. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to drought conditions. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often covered with fine hairs. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
